alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Custer; Garfield; Holt; Loup; Rock; Wheeler (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 7:51PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN ROCK...LOUP... GARFIELD...HOLT...NORTHEASTERN CUSTER...NORTHEASTERN BLAINE AND NORTHWESTERN WHEELER COUNTIES THROUGH 845 PM CDT... At 751 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles northeast of Stuart to 7 miles west of Amelia to 13 miles south of Rose. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... O`Neill, Burwell, Atkinson, Stuart, Chambers, Rose, Amelia, Calamus Reservoir State Recreation Area, Inman, Emmet, Dustin, Fox Bayou, Virginia Smith Dam, Kent Diversion Dam State Wildlife Management Area, Carson Lake, Sunfish Lake, Homestead Knolls Campground, Opportunity, Nunda Shoal Campground, and Gables. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 126 and 159. Highway 20 between mile markers 273 and 316. Highway 281 between mile markers 154 and 199. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in North Platte. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central Nebraska.

area.areaDesc: Blaine; Custer; Garfield; Holt; Loup; Rock; Wheeler
